comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Former Princeton Professor (of Political Economy -- since 1892) Winthrop More Daniels [born 1867], on January 30, 1914, was appointed by President Woodrow Wilson to a vacant seat on the Interstate Commerce Commission. In 1911, Wilson, who was then the Governor of New Jersey, had appointed Daniels to a six-year term on the Board of Public Utility Examiners of New Jersey. New York Times story, January 31, 1914: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?_r=1&res=9407E...

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: Wystan:  Thanks for the additional info. about Daniels.  We'll include it next time we update the description.
